intro: Ourisia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited ourisia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Ourisia macrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
